note: 102; R. E. Rainey, ‘Sumptuary Legislation in Renaissance Florence’ (unpublished doctoral dissertation,
title: Sumptuary Law in Italy 1200–1500

For the period c. 1250–1400, Florence had by far the most legislation with thirty-six enactments, followed by Bologna with seventeen, Siena with twelve, Lucca with eleven, Venice with ten, and Perugia with seven. In the same period seigneurial Milan and Verona had only three. On the reasons for sumptuary legislation see Killerby, Sumptuary Law
On this and for what follows see Killerby, Sumptuary Law
